intro: Fernandezia theodorii, commonly known as the Theodore's fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display. Fernandezia theodorii is also noted for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a resilient addition to Mediterranean-style landscapes.
